intro: Salacia prinoides var. macrophylla, commonly known as the large-leaf salacia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Celastraceae. It is native to the tropical rainforests of Southeast Asia, particularly in regions such as Malaysia and Indonesia. The plant is characterized by its large, elliptical leaves that can reach up to 30 cm in length. It produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in umbels, followed by bright red berries that are edible but have a bitter taste. This species is often found in lowland and hill forest areas, thriving in humid and shaded environments.
